definition: To make a surface smoother or more even by removing irregularities or wrinkles, often done by applying pressure or using a tool. It is commonly used when referring to the action of smoothing out fabric, paper, or other materials.

examples.english: I need to straighten my hair.

examples.german: Sie versuchte, die Falten in ihrem Kleid zu glätten.
examples.english: She tried to smooth out the wrinkles in her dress.

examples.german: Der Handwerker glättete die Oberfläche des Holztisches.
examples.english: The craftsman smoothed the surface of the wooden table.

examples.german: Er benutzte einen Glätteisen, um seine Hemden zu glätten.
examples.english: He used a flat iron to iron his shirts.

examples.german: Die Straßenarbeiter glätteten den frisch asphaltierten Weg.
examples.english: The road workers smoothed the freshly paved path.
